oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter Draft
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mardi Gras; clothing; correspondence;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Draft of part of a letter discussing importation of costumes from Paris, France: advises that the shipment of costumes be appraised in France at a market value at the place of manufacture; the costumes cannot be considered "merchandise," for "after the glory of one day's display has passed" they are only fit for the "rag-merchant, and the paper-mill": writer intends to discuss the matter with customs authorities; on verso list of payments to be made for costumes in five installments.
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Manuscript collection processed by John Jones
